name: Myristic Acid
description: Cleansing agent that also creates foam and can be drying.

name: N6-Furfuryladenine
description: Technical name for kinetin.

name: N-Acetyl-L Tyrosine
description: A form of the amino acid L-tyrosine, it functions as a skin-conditioning agent.

name: Nettle Extract
description: Extract that may have soothing properties.

name: Nigella Sativa Seed Oil
key_points: Also known as black cumin seed oil and black caraway seed oil | Contains bioactive ingredient thymoquinone | Antioxidant compounds help curb the effects of environmental stress | May contain skin irritating volatile fragrance compounds
description: Nigella sativa seed oil

name: Nymphaea Alba Root Extract
key_points: Plant extract derived from the roots of Nymphaea alba, AKA water lily | Contains antioxidant compounds like rutin and quercetin | Helps mitigate pro-aging environmental damage | Also used in hair care applications
description: An antioxidant derived from the roots of water lilies (Nymphaea alba).

name: Ocimum Basilicum flower extract
key_points: Plant-extract taken from the flower of Ocimum basilicum, AKA sweet basil | Rich in antioxidants such as flavonoids and phenolic compounds | Helps renew skin's protection from daily aggressors that lead to  signs of aging | Is often combined with Ocimum basilicum leaf extract
description: Plant extract sourced from the flower of the sweet basil plant that has  potential antioxidant properties.

name: Ocimum Basilicum leaf extract
key_points: Plant-extract derived from Ocimum basilicum, AKA sweet basil | Rich in antioxidants like rosmarinic acid, ferulic acid, and rutin | Helps protect skin from pro-aging environmental aggressors | Contains sin-sensitizing tannins
description: Plant extract that assists in neutralizing damage caused by environmental stressors, including pollution and UV rays. Contains skin-sensitizing tannins.

name: Oleth-3 Phosphate
key_points: mproves formula texture, mixing oil and water ingredients | Assists in dispersing insoluble compounds in products | Exists as a liquid with a colorless-to-brown raw material | Might be skin-sensitizing
description: Cleansing, emulsifying and dispersing agent that helps to create uniform textures.

name: Oridonin
categories: Anti-Aging, Antioxidant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Herb-derived skin care ingredient | Shows potential for enhancing skin longevity | May be irritating (research shows mixed results) | More robust testing is needed to confirm safety and efficacy
description: Herb-derived ingredient with anti-aging benefits; presents potential risk of irritation due to fragrant compounds.

name: Padimate O
description: Sunscreen agent that protects skin primarily from the sun's UVB rays.

name: Paeonia Albiflora Extract
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
description: Fragrant plant extract.

name: Paeonia Albiflora Flower Extract
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
description: Fragrant plant extract.

name: Paeonia Suffruticosa Extract
categories: Plant Extracts, Antioxidant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
description: This plant extract, commonly known as peony, is a source of antioxidants, but also fragrance components that can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Panicum Miliaceum
description: Extract from a cereal grain that has no established benefit for skin, but is added to cosmetic formularies as a skin-softening agent.

name: Panicum Millaceum (Millet) Seed Extract
description: Extract from a cereal grain that has no established benefit for skin, but is added to cosmetic formularies as a skin-softening agent.

name: Pansy Extract
description: Extract for which there is a small amount of research showing it has skin soothing and antioxidant properties.

name: PEG-7 Trimethylolpropane Coconut Ether
key_points: Type of polyethylene glycol compound derived from coconuts | Emulsifier and surfactant | Can be part of an ingredient blend called SEPIPLUS™ S
description: This coconut-derived ingredient works as an emulsifier and surfactant in cosmetics.

name: Perilla Ocymoides
description: Also known as beefsteak plant. Like many plants, the leaves contain flavones which help the plant survive in natural sunlight.

name: Phenylethyl Resorcinol
description: Synthetic antioxidant often seen in skin-brightening products.

name: Phthalates
description: Phthalates refers to a wide range of substances that are very different from one another.

name: Pistacia Lentiscus (Mastic) Gum
categories: Pore Minimizer, Antioxidant, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Resin of the mastic tree native to north Africa & the Mediterranean | Has been used in traditional Greek medicine for centuries | Has antioxidant and astringent properties | Contains volatile compounds that can irritate skin
description: This tree resin has antioxidant and antimicrobial properties, but also has the potential to irritate skin.

name: Plantago Lanceolata Leaf Extract
key_points: Plant extract from the plantain family | Offers beneficial antioxidants that help defend skin from environmental stressors | May potentially have a sensitizing effect on skin due its fragrance compounds and tannin content | Of greater concern when the essential oil form of this ingredient is used
description: Plant extract from the plantain family. Offers beneficial antioxidants but may potentially have a sensitizing effect on skin due its fragrance compounds and tannin content.

name: Plasticizing Agents
description: Ingredients that place a thin layer of plastic over the skin.

name: Polyester-5
key_points: A film-forming agent used in skin care, hair care, and body care formulations | Helps hydrophobic ingredients disperse in aqueous solutions | A water-dispersible polymer that contains a sulfonate group | Assists in controlling the viscosity of formulas
description: Used as a film-former and emulsifying agent in skin care formulations.

name: Poncirus Trifoliata Fruit Extract
categories: Anti-Aging, Antioxidant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Fruit extract that is a citrus relative, commonly known as “hardy orange” | Offers anti-aging and skin-soothing benefits thanks to its antioxidant content | Also contains fragrant compounds, although the risk for irritancy is minimized in extract form | Alternative names include Citrus trifoliata and Trifoliate Orange
description: Fruit extract rich in antioxidants, providing anti-aging and soothing benefits. Also contains fragrant compounds such as limonene, which may cause irritation, but the risk is minimized when the extract form is used.

name: Porphyridium Cruentum Extract
description: Extract derived from a type of red algae.

name: Potassium
description: Important element in diet that is present in such fruits as bananas and citrus.

name: Potassium Laurate
key_points: Cleanser, emulsifier, and foam-boosting agent | Constituent of soap with potential to be drying, depending on the overall formula | Can be sourced naturally (via plants) or synthetically made | Supplied as a water-soluble powder or paste in its raw material form
description: Cleansing agent, emulsifier, and foam booster. It’s a constituent of soap that has the potential to be drying on skin—although formulary steps can be taken to avoid this.

name: PPG-24-Glycereth-24
key_points: Glycerin-based ingredient that functions as an emulsifying agent and surfactant | Used in a variety of skin care formulations, including toners, serums, and moisturizers | Colorless to pale yellow liquid in its raw material form | Most of what we know about this ingredient comes from suppliers, as independent research is lacking
description: Glycerin-based ingredient that functions as an emulsifying agent and surfactant.

name: Prasterone
description: Manmade form of the hormone dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA).

name: Pterocarpus Santalinus
categories: Anti-Aging, Antioxidant, Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
key_points: Type of tree found native to south India | Used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine | Extract has antioxidant and soothing properties | Oil has volatile fragrance components | Also known as red sandalwood
description: Also known as red sandalwood, the benefits of this tree depend on which part of it is being used.

name: Red 27 Lake
description: A synthetic coloring agent approved for use in cosmetics.

name: Red 28
description: Red 28 is a synthetic coloring agent that uses a combination of colors to create its red hue.

name: Red 33
key_points: Pigment used to add color to makeup, food products, and skin care | Ruled safe in its current use
description: This pigment adds color to makeup and skin care products and is considered safe as used in this application.

name: Red 6 Lake
key_points: Pigment used to add color to makeup, food products, and skin care | Ruled safe in its current use | Also known as D&C Red 6 Aluminum Lake
description: Synthetic pigment used to add color to makeup, as well as skin care and food products.

name: Red 7 Lake
key_points: An approved synthetic coloring agent | Also known as D&C Red 7 Calcium Lake | Insoluble in water | Subject to batch certification
description: Red 7 lake is a synthetic coloring agent approved for use in drugs and cosmetics.

name: Riboflavin
description: Also known as vitamin B2, research backing skin benefits for this ingredient are lacking.

name: Ribose
key_points: Hydrating plant sugar that can be derived naturally from corn seeds | Conflicting research in terms of its anti-aging abilities | White-to-tan powder in raw material form | Deemed safe by the Cosmetic Ingredient Review in up to 0.05% concentration
description: Ribose is a hydrating plant sugar with debated anti-aging properties.

name: Rosa Centifolia
description: Also known as the cabbage rose or the Provence rose, this plant can have antioxidant properties.

name: Rosa Centifolia Flower
description: Plant with potential antioxidant benefits for skin.

name: Rosa Centifolia Seed Extract
description: The seed extract from a plant known as the cabbage rose or the Provence rose. It can have antioxidant properties.

name: Royal Jelly
description: The myriad claims about royal jelly are anecdotal and have no research to substantiate them.

name: Ruscus Aculeatus
description: This shrub, known as butcher's broom, has antioxidant properties.

name: Ruscus Aculeatus Root Extract
description: The root extract of a shrub, known as butcher's broom, that has antioxidant properties.

name: Sage Extract
description: Plant extract that contains components that function as antioxidants. There is some potential for sensitivity with sage extracts, but the risk is relatively low at the amounts used in topical skin care products.

name: Salvia Officinalis
description: Like all plant extracts, this contains components that function as antioxidants. There is some potential for sensitivity with sage extracts, but the risk is relatively low at the amounts used in topical skincare products.

name: Salvia Officinalis (Sage) Extract
description: Plant extract that contains components that function as antioxidants. There is some potential for sensitivity with sage extracts, but the risk is relatively low at the amounts used in topical skin care products.

name: Santalum Album Seed Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Latin name for sandalwood extract, which is used in cosmetics as a fragrance. It can have antioxidant properties. It also can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Saxifraga Sarmentosa Extract
description: Plant extract with potential antioxidant benefits for skin.

name: Serenoa Serrulata Extract
description: Latin name for saw palmetto. There's no research showing topical application of this plant can benefit skin.

name: Siegesbeckia Orientalis
description: Chinese herb (also known as St. Paul's wort) for which there is no research showing that it has any benefit for skin.

name: Siegesbeckia Orientalis Extract
description: Chinese herb (also known as St. Paul's wort) for which there is no research showing that it has any benefit for skin.

name: Silver Chloride
description: An inorganic salt that has no known function in cosmetics.

name: Slippery Elm Bark
description: Plant that can be a good skin-soothing agent but can also be an allergen if used in high amounts.

name: Sodium Anisate
key_points: Sodium salt of p-anisic acid | Used for its preservative properties | Helps extend products’ shelf life | Cosmetics applications use in concentrations between 0.05% and 0.4%
description: Sodium salt of the plant metabolite p-anisic acid used as a preservative.

name: Sodium Bicarbonate
description: A synthetic inorganic salt more commonly known as baking soda. It has many functions in cosmetics, including pH adjuster, buffering agent, and abrasive, such as in face or body scrubs.

name: Sodium Bisulfite
description: Used in acid-type permanent waves to alter the shape of hair. It can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Sodium Chloride
key_points: More popularly known as common table salt | Functions as a binding agent, thickener, and occasionally an abrasive in cosmetics | A white, crystalline solid | On the FDA’s list of substances Generally Recognized as Safe
description: Better known as salt, this ingredient is primarily used to thicken skin and hair care formulations. It also functions as a binding agent and sometimes a scrub particle in physical exfoliants.

name: Sodium Cocoate
key_points: Surfactant derived from coconut acid | Also acts as an emulsifying agent | Used in soaps, shampoos and other hygiene products | Potential for moderate skin irritation (formulation dependent)
description: Surfactant and emulsifier found in bar soaps and other personal care cleansing products.

name: Sodium Coco Sulfate
key_points: Cleansing agent commonly used in rinse-off products | Referred to as a “milder” alternative to sodium lauryl sulfate | Also assists in emulsification and foam creation | Can potentially irritate skin due to its anionic nature
description: Cleansing agent that also assists in foam creation. Often used as an alternative to sodium lauryl sulfate.

name: Sodium Formate
key_points: A preservative that helps prolong a product’s shelf life | Helps neutralize and bring balance to a skin care formulation’s pH | Is the salt form of the preservative formic acid | Used in cosmetics and hair care in concentrations of up to .34% | Deemed safe in cosmetic and hair formulations by the Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel
description: Preservative and buffering agent used in cosmetic formulations to help prolong shelf life and balance the pH of formulas.

name: Sodium Hydroxide
key_points: Highly alkaline ingredient | Used in small amounts in cosmetics (such as in exfoliants and cleansers) to adjust pH | Is used in hair and nail products to maintain pH | Also known as lye
description: Also known as lye, this ingredient is highly alkaline, meaning it is on the basic side of the pH range (its pH is naturally 13). It is used in small amounts in cosmetics (such as cleansers and exfoliants) adjust their pH.

name: Sodium Hydroxymethylglycinate
description: Amino acid derivative used as a skin-softening agent; can also function as a preservative.

name: Sodium Lactobionate
description: White, crystalline powder used to synthesize other chemicals. May function as a preservative in...

name: Sodium Lauryl Sulfoacetate
key_points: Cleansing agent noted for its foaming properties | Long history of use in personal care products, with research dating back to the 1940’s | Deemed safe by the Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel | Raw material form: white powder or flakes
description: Mild cleansing agent noted for its foaming properties.

name: Sodium Metabisulfite
key_points: Used as a preservative and stabilizer in cosmetic formulations | Also offers antioxidant properties | In hair care, it acts as a reducing agent that alters the structure of hair | Described as colorless crystals or a white to yellowish crystalline powder in raw material form
description: Plays a multitasking role as a preservative, stabilizer, and antioxidant.

name: Sodium Palmate
key_points: Surfactant in bar soaps and other skin-cleansers | Increases formulary viscosity | Also plays an emulsifying role | Derived from palm oil
description: Surfactant, emulsifier and viscosity-adjusting agent commonly found in bar soaps and other cleansers.

name: Sodium Palmitate
key_points: Sodium salt of palmitic acid | Surfactant + emulsifying and viscosity increasing agent | Ruled safe as used in skin care | Can be drying to skin when formulated in a cleanser | Typical usage in leave-on products is 0.06-4.1%
description: This sodium salt of palmitic acid can be drying to skin when formulated in a cleanser.

name: Sodium Palm Kernelate
key_points: Surfactant in bar soaps and other skin-cleansers | Plays secondary emulsifier and viscosity-adjusting roles | Derived from palm kernel oil that's treated with sodium hydroxide | Falls in the mid-range for mild-to-harsh surfactants
description: Surfactant, emulsifier, and viscosity-adjusting agent commonly found in bar soaps and other cleansers.

name: Sodium Phosphate
key_points: Synthetic phosphorous compound | Has wetting and cleansing properties | Commonly used in blends to keep ingredients mixed | Considered safe as used in cosmetics
description: A synthetic wetting agent that has cleansing, thickening and emulsifying properties for skin. Chemically classified as a phosphorous compound.

name: Sodium Salicylate
description: Salt form of salicylic acid (BHA). Because it is not the acid form of salicylate (i.e., salicylic...

name: Sodium Stearate
key_points: Cleansing/emulsifying agent | Can be used to adjust the viscosity and stiffness of a formulation | May also lend itself waterproofing qualities | Often used in solid-style products such as stick-based sunscreens, bar soaps, and waxes | May potentially contribute to a pore-clogging residue on skin (depending on the overall formula)
description: Cleansing/emulsifying agent that can also be used to adjust the viscosity and stiffness of cosmetic formulations. It might contribute to a pore-clogging residue on skin.

name: Sodium Sulfite
description: Reducing agent that alters the structure of hair. It can also be used as a preservative in cosmetic formulations, and can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Solanum Lycopersicum Extract
description: Extract that has weak antioxidant properties. May be a potential skin sensitizer.

name: Sorbitan Oleate Decylglucoside Crosspolymer
key_points: Surfactant with cleansing, emulsifying, and foaming properties | Can also be used to solubilize fragrance ingredients | May be sourced naturally (via corn, sugar or olive oil) or synthetically created | Used in shampoos, body washes, hair gels, after shaves, lotions, deodorants, etc.
description: Surfactant with cleansing, emulsifying, and foaming properties. Can also be used to solubilize fragrance ingredients in a formulation.

name: St. John's Wort
description: Contains several components that are harmful to skin in the presence of sunlight.

name: Succinoglycan
key_points: An exopolysaccharide derived from soil bacteria | High molecular weight carbohydrate infrequently used in cosmetics | Has emulsifying and texture-enhancing properties | Research is also exploring its use in various medical fields
description: A natural polysaccharide derived from soil bacteria. Not widely used in cosmetics, but can help enhance texture and help emulsify.

name: Sugarcane Extract
description: Ingredients like sugarcane extract, fruit extracts, mixed fruit extracts, and milk solids may claim an association with AHAs, but they are not the same thing nor do they have the same beneficial effect on skin.

name: Talc
categories: Oil Control, Absorbent, Texture Enhancer, Occlusive/Opacifying Agent
key_points: A natural mineral composed of magnesium, hydrogen, oxygen and silicon | Serves as an absorbent in skin care | Requires a specific screening process for safety
description: Naturally occurring mineral composed of magnesium, hydrogen, oxygen, and silicon which combine to form what's known as anhydrous (contains no water) magnesium silicate.

name: Tallow
key_points: Rendered beef or mutton fat | Long used as a multi-purpose oil | Rich in triglycerides | Lacking in evidence behind skin healing claims | Pure tallow can irritate skin via barrier damage
description: This rendered animal fat has moisturizing properties but also has the potential to irritate skin.

name: Tanacetum Parthenium (Feverfew)
description: Can be very soothing or potentially sensitizing to skin, depending on which components of the plant are included.

name: TBHQ
key_points: Derivative of hydroquinone that does not have discoloration fight properties | Preservative used to enhance the stability of formulas | Common food additive | Ruled safe as used in cosmetics | White to light tan crystalline solid in its raw form
description: This derivative of hydroquinone is used as a cosmetic preservative and has been ruled safe in its current use.

name: TEA
description: Used in cosmetics as a pH balancer. Like all amines, it has the potential for creating nitrosamines.

name: Thiamine HCL
description: Vitamin B1. There is no research showing this to be effective when applied topically on skin.

name: Thiodipropionic Acid
description: Acid-based synthetic antioxidant. There is no research pertaining to its benefit for skin, but in theory, and when stably packaged, it should exert an antioxidant effect when applied topically.

name: Thyme Extract
description: Extract derived from the leaf or flower of the thyme plant. It can have potent antioxidant properties but may also cause skin sensitivity due to fragrant components.

name: Thymus Hydrolysate
description: Has hydrating properties for skin.

name: Thymus Serpillum Extract
description: Extract of wild thyme.

name: Thymus Vulgaris
description: Derived from the leaf or flower of the thyme plant. It can have potent antioxidant properties but may also cause skin sensitivity due to fragrant components.

name: Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Extract
description: Extract derived from the leaf or flower of the thyme plant. It can have potent antioxidant properties but may also cause skin sensitivity due to fragrant components.

name: Tomato Extract
description: Extract that has weak antioxidant properties. May be a potential skin sensitizer.

name: Triethanolamine
description: Used in cosmetics as a pH balancer. Like all amines, it has the potential for creating nitrosamines.

name: Tromethamine
key_points: Triol, or alcohol with three hydroxyl groups along with one amino group | Used in skin care as a pH adjuster and as a neutralizing agent for fatty acids in a formulation | Can reduce a formula’s chance of irritation | Can function as a buffering agent in alkaline range of 7-9 | CIR Expert Panel deemed safe for use in cosmetics at current levels
description: pH adjusting ingredient used to help neutralize acidic formulas and ingredients.

name: Ulmus Fulva Bark Extract
description: Plant that can be a good skin-soothing agent but can also be an allergen if used in high amounts.

name: Ultramarines
description: Inorganic pigments (of various colors) permanently listed by the FDA for external use only.

name: Ulva Lactuca Extract
description: Extract from the plant known as sea lettuce, it has some soothing and antioxidant properties for skin.

name: Urtica Dioica
categories: Hydration, Soothing, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant, Humectant
description: Plant extract that may have soothing properties.

name: Urtica Dioica (Nettle) Extract
categories: Hydration, Soothing, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant, Humectant
description: Plant extract that may have soothing properties.

name: Vegetable Collagen
key_points: Refers to plant-based ingredients intended to mimic animal collagen | Not recognized as an official INCI ingredient but blanket term for various ingredient blends | Benefits depend on the actual mix of ingredients (don’t assume pro-collagen results) | If going the vegetable/vegan collagen oral supplement route, consult your physician
description: A term loosely interpreted by skin care brands, referring to plant-based ingredients that are intended to mimic animal-sourced collagen.

name: Viola Tricolor Extract
description: Plant extract for which there is a small amount of research showing it has skin soothing and antioxidant properties.

name: Vitamin B1
description: There is no research showing this to be effective when applied topically on skin.

name: Vitamin B2
description: Also known as riboflavin, research backing skin benefits for this ingredient are lacking.

name: Vitamin B6
description: There is no research showing it to have benefit for skin.

name: Vitamin H
description: Also known as biotin, this water-soluble vitamin produced in the body is considered part of the B complex group of vitamins.

name: Walnut Extract
description: Extract that can have antioxidant properties.

name: White Nettle
description: Contains components that can have both soothing and sensitizing properties.

name: Yellow 5
description: Coloring agent/pigment that is used to adjust the hue of cosmetic formulas.

name: Yellow 5 Lake
description: Yellow 5 lake is synthetic coloring agent approved for use in foods, drugs and cosmetics.

name: Yellow 6 Lake
description: A pigment that is FDA-approved for use in cosmetics and food products.

name: Yogurt
description: There's limited research showing that yogurt is effective when applied topically.

name: Yucca Extract
description: Plant extract that can have soothing benefits.

name: Yucca Schidigera
description: The Latin name for yucca, this plant can have antioxidant and soothing benefits for skin.

name: Yucca Schidigera Leaf/Root/Stem Extract
description: Plant extract that can have soothing benefits.

name: Zanthoxylum Bungeanum Fruit Oil
key_points: Also known as prickly ash oil | Has antioxidant benefits | Also has skin-calming abilities | Contains skin sensitizing compounds
description: This oil derived from the prickly ash plant has some beneficial properties but can also irritate skin.

name: Zea Mays (Corn) Kernel Meal
key_points: The independent Cosmetic Ingredient Review panel has ruled Zea mays kernel meal safe as currently used in cosmetics, where its maximum concentration of use is 3%.
description: This ingredient, also known as cornmeal, is used in cosmetics as a bulking agent and physical exfoliant

name: Zingiberaceae
key_points: Plant family AKA the ginger family | Applied topically and ingested | Extracts can provide anti-aging, antioxidant-based benefits | Oils can cause skin sensitivity
description: Zingiberaceae is a family of flowering plants (AKA the ginger family) that produces an array of antioxidant-rich skin care ingredients, some of which can be sensitizing.

name: Zingiber Officinale Roscoe
description: The extract form of this plant, also known as ginger, is generally considered non-volatile (non-irritating) while the oil form contains over 50 such components with potential to aggravate skin.

name: Acetic Acid
key_points: Byproduct of fermentation | Main component of vinegar aside from water | Used to adjust skin care products’ pH | Has mild antimicrobial properties | Overuse or misuse can result in skin damage
description: This type of acid is a major component of vinegar and can cause skin irritation.

name: Alkyloamides
description: Identified on skin care product labels as DEA, triethanolamine (TEA), and monoethanolamine (MEA).

name: Amyl Cinnamate
key_points: Also known as pentyl cinnamate | Fragrance ingredient also used in food | Studies show it can cause skin irritation | Colorless to pale yellow liquid in its raw form
description: This fragrance ingredient can cause irritation when applied to skin.

name: Apricot Kernel
description: Often used as an abrasive agent in so-called "natural" scrubs.

name: Asimina Triloba Fruit Extract
description: This plant extract, also known as pawpaw, has antioxidant properties but can also irritate skin.

name: Blue Tansy
categories: Antioxidant, Coloring Agent/Pigment, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Plant-derived volatile oil AKA Tanacetum annuum oil | Contains fragrant, potentially sensitizing compounds | Has chamazulene, an antioxidant with colorant and fragrant properties | Not yet reviewed by the CIR Expert Panel
description: A potentially sensitizing, fragrant essential oil used for its colorant, scent, and antioxidant properties.

name: Calendula Officinalis Flower Oil
categories: Antioxidant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Essential oil taken from the Calendula officinalis, AKA pot marigold, flower | Contains volatile, aromatic skin-sensitizing compounds | Has antioxidant and antimicrobial properties | Used in cosmetics in concentrations between 0.01-0.1%
description: The volatile oil taken from Calendula officinalis flowers. Contains skin-sensitizing fragrant compounds but also has antioxidant properties.

name: Cocamide DEA And MEA
description: Both cocamide DEA (diethanolamine) and MEA (monoethanolamine) are widely used ingredients to thicken the water phase of cosmetics, keep ingredients blended, and boost foaming properties...

name: Colloidal Sulfur
key_points: Smaller particles than sulfur, making it more potent | Anti-acne properties help tackle breakouts | Can cause skin irritation and sensitization | Most effective in skin care preparations between 3% and 10%
description: Possesses anti-acne properties but can also irritate skin when applied topically. Has smaller particles than sulfur, making it more potent.

name: Diamond Powder
key_points: Abrasive mineral (technically a crystallized modification of carbon) | Used in skin care products such as exfoliating cleansers where it provides buffing/scrubbing action | May cause micro tears in skin due to the irregular shape of the particles | Research supporting diamond powder’s use in cosmetics is lacking
description: Diamond powder is an abrasive mineral used in skin care products such as exfoliating cleansers where it provides buffing/scrubbing action.

name: Diatomaceous Earth
description: Light-colored porous rock composed of the skeletons of minute sea creatures called diatoms.

name: Diazolidinyl Urea
description: Water-soluble preservative.

name: Dicalcium Phosphate
key_points: White powder that can be used to create abrasive formulations (think gritty exfoliating scrubs) | May also be formulated in a non-abrasive way for use as an opacifying agent in makeup | Can inhibit the transfer/smearing of makeup | Popular in oral care products, such as toothpaste.
description: White powder that can be used to create abrasive formulations (not recommended) or can be formulated in a way that lends opacity to makeup (which is not problematic).

name: Dimethyl MEA
description: Controversial ingredient for skin because research has shown conflicting results. It seems to offer an initial benefit that improves skin firmness, but these results are short-lived and eventually give way to destruction of the substances in skin that help keep it firm.

name: DMAE
key_points: Also known as dimethyl MEA | Research shows it may promote skin firmness | However, results are short lived and can result in destruction of firming skin substances | Requires a pH of 10 to remain efficacy and stability
description: Controversial ingredient for skin because research has shown conflicting results. It seems to offer an initial benefit that improves skin firmness, but these results are short-lived and eventually give way to destruction of the substances in skin that help keep it firm.

name: DMDM Hydantoin
description: Formaldehyde-releasing preservative.

name: Farnesol
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
description: Extract of plants that is used in cosmetics primarily for fragrance.

name: Farnesyl Acetate
description: Ingredient used in cosmetics primarily for fragrance.

name: Formaldehyde-Releasing Preservative
description: Common type of preservative found in cosmetics.

name: Geraniol
description: A volatile fragrance ingredient extracted from geranium, geraniol is capable of causing sensitivity when applied to skin.

name: Gold
key_points: Metallic element whose skin care benefits remain unproven | Potential source of skin irritation | Also goes by the INCI Name CI 77480 as a colorant | Although related to colloidal gold, the two differ greatly in their cosmetic functions
description: Metallic element whose skin care benefits remain unproven. Potential source of skin irritation.

name: Hedera Helix Extract
key_points: Commonly known as English ivy extract | Contains phytosterols and flavonoids | Also a source of skin-irritating falcarinol | Research has shown allergic reactions to cosmetics containing this ingredient
description: This extract, also known as English ivy extract, can irritate and sensitize skin.

name: Hoya Lacunosa Flower Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Derived from the flowers of the Hoya lacunosa plant | Poses potential risk of skin sensitization due to fragrant compounds | Lacking independent research to support supplier claims | Alternative names include cinnamon-scented wax plant and porcelain flower extract
description: Extract derived from the flowers of the Hoya lacunosa plant, whose fragrant compounds pose a risk of skin sensitization.

name: Hydroxyethylpiperazine Ethane Sulfonic Acid
description: Also known by the acronym HEPES, hydroxyethylpiperazine ethane sulfonic acid is a buffering ingredient typically used to establish a neutral pH in water-based solutions.

name: Imidazolidinyl Urea
description: Considered a weaker preservative than its "cousin" diazolidinyl urea.

name: Iron Powder
description: Iron powder is, as the name states, a powdered versoin of the mineral iron. A natural ingredient, it's used as an opacifying agent in cosmetics.

name: MEA
description: Abbreviation for monoethanolamine.

name: Melia Azadirachta Oil
key_points: Derived from the Melia azadirachta or Azadirachta indica tree | Also known as neem oil | Contains antioxidant and emollient properties | Can sensitize skin due to potent active compounds
description: Plant-derived oil, AKA neem oil, that has potent active compounds that can sensitize skin.

name: Methyldihydrojasmonate
key_points: Used as a masking or fragrance component in skin care | Exhibits a floral, jasmine scent | Like other fragrant ingredients, can cause short-term and long-term skin sensitization | Is a colorless-to-light yellow liquid in its raw material form
description: Methyldihydrojasmonate is a fragrant compound used in skin care for its floral, jasmine-like scent. Like other fragrances, it can cause skin sensitization.

name: Mimosa Oil Or Extract
key_points: Plant-derived oils and extracts from the Acacia dealbata shrub | Contains phenolic compounds that provide antioxidant properties | As an essential oil, contains volatile aromatic compounds that can sensitize skin | The Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel could not verify its skin safety due to lack of research
description: Mimosa oil or extract are fragrant, antioxidant ingredients derived from the Acacia dealbata plant. Their aromatic compounds can cause skin sensitization.

name: Myrtle Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
key_points: Also known as Myrtus communis extract | Contains sensitizing, aromatic compounds, like linalool and limonene | Offers antioxidant benefits for skin | Can help skin combat organisms that contribute to breakouts
description: Antioxidant and antimicrobial ingredient, AKA Myrtus communis extract, that also contains volatile, sensitizing aromatic compounds.

name: Myrtus Communis Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
key_points: A plant extract also known as Myrtle extract | Contains sensitizing, fragrant components, like linalool and limonene | Has established antioxidant benefits | Can help skin combat environments that contribute to breakouts
description: Antioxidant and antimicrobial ingredient that contains volatile, sensitizing aromatic compounds.

name: Neem Oil
key_points: Plant-derived ingredient, AKA Melia azadirachta oil | Derived from the Melia azadirachta or Azadirachta indica tree | Has emollient and antioxidant properties | Can cause skin sensitization and signs of irritation
description: A plant oil derived from the seeds and fruit of the Melia azadirachta, AKA Azadirachta indica, tree. Can cause skin sensitization.

name: Papaya Extract
categories: Smooths Bumpy Skin, Exfoliant, Plant Extracts, Irritant
description: Extract that is the source of papain, which theoretically can have exfoliating properties on skin.

name: Paullinia Cupana Seed Extract
key_points: Also called guarana seed extract | Native to the Amazon | Has beneficial phenolic compounds | Also constricts skin
description: This extract from the guarana plant has antioxidant properties but also constricts skin.

name: Pawpaw Extract
description: This plant extract has antioxidant properties but can also irritate skin.

name: Perfluorodecalin
key_points: Synthetic ingredient, classified as a perfluorocarbon | Solvent and texture-enhancing ingredient that may increase oxygen to skin | May boost reactive oxygen species (ROS) in skin, which can age skin faster | Often used in “bubble masks”
description: Solvent and texture-enhancing ingredient that increases oxygen to skin, which may actually boost the presence of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in skin—the very thing antioxidants fight against.

name: Perfluorohexane
key_points: Synthetic ingredient, classified as a perfluorocarbon | Solvent and texture-enhancing ingredient that may increase oxygen to skin | May boost reactive oxygen species (ROS) in skin, which can age skin faster | Often used in “bubble masks”
description: Solvent and texture-enhancing ingredient that increases oxygen to skin, which may actually boost the presence of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in skin—the very thing antioxidants fight against.

name: Phenylpropanol
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Preservative, Solvent
key_points: Masking scent used in skin care formulas | Also serves as a preservative, extending product shelf life | Potentially irritating to skin | Used in concentrations of up to .3%
description: Preservative and fragrant compound used as a masking scent in cosmetics. Potentially irritating to skin.

name: Polyperfluoroperhydrophenanthrene
key_points: Fluorocarbon made up of fluorine and carbon | Mostly used in ingredient blends | Utilized as a solvent | More research is needed to determine its safety
description: A solvent and potential PFAS that is often used as part of an ingredient blend.

name: Polyvinyl Alcohol
description: A synthetic polymer of vinyl alcohol that functions in cosmetics as a gel-based thickener, film-forming, and binding agent.

name: Potassium Hydroxide
description: Also known as lye, a highly alkaline ingredient used in small amounts in cosmetics.

name: Potassium Myristate
description: Detergent cleansing agent that is a constituent of soap; it can be drying and aggravate skin for some.

name: Quaternium-15
description: Formaldehyde-releasing preservative used in cosmetics. It can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Quercus Robur (Oak) Root Extract
key_points: Plant-derived ingredient taken from the English oak tree | Can help protect skin from external aggressors | Contains tannins, which denature skin | Might contribute to skin barrier disruptions
description: A plant-derived ingredient rich in antioxidants that contains tannins, which denature proteins in skin’s surface, resulting in sensitization.

name: Rosa Damascena Flower Water
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Fragrant solution obtained from the flowers of the damask rose | Poses a risk of irritation to skin due to its volatile compounds | May also be referred to simply as rose water | Claims such as calming redness and reducing acne have not been proven to be true
description: Fragrant solution obtained from the flowers of the damask rose, which poses a risk of irritation to skin.

name: Sclareolide
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Fragrance ingredient with a musky/woody aroma | Potentially problematic for long-term skin health | May be extracted from plants such as clary sage | White crystalline powder in raw form
description: Fragrance ingredient with a musky/woody aroma; may be problematic for skin.

name: Sea Salt
description: Can be effective as a topical scrub, but if left on skin it can increase the risk of a sensitized reaction.

name: Silt
description: A sediment obtained from various bodies of water. Silt's absorbent nature helps it function to absorb excess surface oil.

name: Sodium Laurate
key_points: Sodium salt of lauric acid | Classified as a soap | Strong potential to irritate skin | Damages skin’s barrier | White solid in its raw form
description: This type of soap can cause irritation and lasting damage to skin’s barrier.

name: Tanacetum Annuum Flower Oil
key_points: Fragrant essential oil, also known as blue tansy | Imparts a characteristically blue hue (thanks to its chemical component chamazulene) | Poses a risk of sensitizing skin and causing a cascade of damage on a deeper level | Alternatively, may offer aromatherapeutic benefits
description: Fragrant essential oil (also known as blue tansy) that poses a risk of sensitizing skin.

name: Tea Tree Oil
categories: Anti-Acne, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant, Irritant
key_points: Essential oil with a distinctive herbal/medicinal scent even at low concentrations | Contains volatile compounds that are known to be skin sensitizing | May help visibly improve breakout-prone skin (when properly incorporated) | Has antimicrobial, anti-viral, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory properties | Irritation risk increases when tea tree oil oxidizes—proper storage is essential
description: Tea tree oil contains volatile components (such as linalool, limonene, and eucalyptol) that can be sensitizing to skin.

name: Verbena Officinalis Leaf Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Plant extract rich in antioxidants | Poses irritation risk due to fragrant compounds | Known for lemony aroma with sweet, fruity undertones | Also goes by the common name vervain extract
description: Antioxidant-rich plant extract that’s iffy for skin due to volatile fragrance compounds.

name: Vetiver Zizanoides Root Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Plant that may offer some beneficial properties but can also be a skin sensitizer due to fragrant components (depending on which part of the plant was used).

name: Walnut Shell Powder
description: Abrasive used in scrub products; not preferred to polyethylene beads.

name: Acetone
key_points: Organic compound found in trees, volcanic gases, and the human body | Solvent commonly used in nail polish removers | Colorless liquid that is volatile and highly flammable | Skin, eye, nose, and lung irritant
description: This solvent is commonly used as nail polish remover and can irritate skin and mucus membranes.

name: Advanced Glycation Endproduct (AGE)
key_points: Destructive substances generated in the body | Product of consuming refined sugars | Destroy collagen and elastin | Can cause abnormal melanin production
description: Advanced glycation endproducts, also known as AGEs, are caused by the body's major fuel source, namely glucose.

name: Pterocarpus Santalinus
categories: Anti-Aging, Antioxidant, Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
key_points: Type of tree found native to south India | Used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine | Extract has antioxidant and soothing properties | Oil has volatile fragrance components | Also known as red sandalwood
description: Also known as red sandalwood, this fragrance ingredient poses a risk of irritating skin.

name: Advanced Glycation Endproduct (AGE)
key_points: Destructive substances generated in the body | Product of consuming refined sugars | Destroy collagen and elastin | Can cause abnormal melanin production
description: Advanced glycation endproducts are caused by the body's major fuel source, namely glucose.

name: Alkaline
description: Anything with a pH higher than 7 is alkaline; a pH below 7 is acidic.

name: Alpha Isomethyl Ionone
key_points: Has a strong, flowery scent | Research shows it can cause allergic skin reactions | Considered an allergen in the European Union | One of the scent components of Chanel No. 5
description: This flavor and fragrance compound is well known for its sensitizing properties.

name: Amyl Cinnamal
key_points: Volatile fragrance ingredient with a jasmine-like aroma | Occurs naturally in some plants, but the ingredient used in products is typically synthetic | Proven to frequently cause skin reactions | Even if you don’t see or feel the negative effects on skin, long term damage occurrs under the surface
description: Volatile fragrance ingredient known to be sensitizing to skin. Should be avoided.

name: Amyl Salicylate
key_points: Ester of amyl alcohol and salicylic acid | No research showing any skin benefit | Studies show it can be a contact allergen | Could pose a risk to some marine wildlife species
description: This synthetic fragrance ingredient has been shown to cause allergic contact dermatitis.

name: Amyris Balsamifera Bark Oil
categories: Irritant, Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
key_points: Essential oil extracted from Amyris balsamifera tree | Primarily a fragrance ingredient | Has a smell that resembles sandalwood | Has herbicidal, larvicidal, and antimicrobial properties | Contains eugenol, which can irritate and sensitize skin
description: This fragrance ingredient contains components that can cause skin irritation and sensitivity.

name: Angelica Archangelica Root Oil
categories: Irritant, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant, Humectant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
key_points: Oil extracted from the root of an alpine plant | Has antioxidant properties | Also has a high amount of skin-sensitizing limonene | Used primarily as a flavor and fragrance ingredient
description: This oil from the root of an alpine plant contains a high amount of skin-sensitizing limonene.

name: Anisaldehyde
description: Synthetic fragrance used in cosmetics.

name: Anise
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Also known as aniseed, it can have antioxidant properties.

name: Arnica Extract
description: Extract from the plant Arnica montana.

name: Awapuhi
description: English name for wild ginger.

name: Balm Mint Extract
description: Extract derived from a fragrant plant; it poses some risk of causing skin sensitivity.

name: Balsam Peru
description: Fatty resin that when applied topically can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Bay Leaf Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
key_points: Plant extract AKA Laurus nobilis leaf oil | Can have antioxidant and soothing effects | Contains fragrant compounds that can damage skin | Might cause redness, flaking and dryness
description: Fragrant volatile oil and plant extract taken from the Laurus nobilis plant that can sensitize skin.

name: Bee Pollen
description: Can have antioxidant properties.

name: Benzoin Extract
description: Balsam resin that has some fragrant properties; it may also be sensitizing to skin.

name: Benzyl Benzoate
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Solvent
key_points: Volatile fragrance ingredient and solvent known to irritate skin | Disrupts naturally protective lipids within skin | Used in many beauty products, including baby care, skin care, hair products, and makeup | Found in plants such as plumeria and cinnamon but can also be synthetically made
description: Benzyl benzoate is a volatile fragrance ingredient and solvent with documented skin irritancy effects.

name: Benzyl Salicylate
key_points: Volatile fragrance chemical | Has a sweet, floral odor | Can cause negative skin reactions even in small amounts
description: A volatile fragrance chemical with a sweet, floral odor used to impart scent to cosmetic products and perfumes.

name: Bergamot Oil

description: This citrus oil is known to sensitize skin, especially when it’s exposed to UV light.

name: Bitter Orange Flower
description: Used topically, this ingredient's methanol content makes it potentially sensitizing for skin.

name: Black Locust Extract
description: Extract that can have antioxidant properties, although it also may have harmful components.

name: Black Pepper Extract And Oil
description: It can cause significant skin sensitivity...

name: Bois De Rose Oil
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
key_points: Primarily used as a fragrance ingredient | Contains high amounts of sensitizing linalool | Also called rosewood oil
description: This oil contains high amounts of fragrance chemical linalool, which causes skin irritation.

name: Borate

name: Borax
key_points: Naturally occurring alkaline compound | Used as a preservative, texture enhancer, and insecticide | Strong potential to cause skin irritation | Colorless crystalline solid in its raw form
description: This naturally occurring alkaline compound poses a strong risk of sensitizing skin.

categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant

description: Commonly known as frankincense oil, this ingredient’s volatile compounds can sensitize skin.

name: Bronopol
key_points: Used as a preservative in numerous commercial applications | Has broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity | Can cause allergic contact dermatitis | White crystals in its raw form

description: Fragrant ingredient whose floral-like scent can cause skin irritation and may also pose health risks when inhaled.

name: Cajeputi Oil

name: Camphor

key_points: Aromatic substance | Sometimes obtained from tree wood | Produces a cooling effect on skin | Can cause skin sensitivity with repeated use | Can also induce sensitivity of the mucus membranes and eyes
description: Aromatic substance obtained from the wood of a tree common to Southeast Asia.

name: Cananga Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Irritant
description: Fragrance used in cosmetics; it can be sensitizing to skin, much like ylang ylang.

name: Capsaicin

name: Capsicum Oleoresin

name: Cardamom

name: Carvone

name: Cedarwood
description: Fragrant plant extract. There is evidence that cedarwood oil is sensitizing.

name: Cedrus Atlantica Bark Extract
description: Fragrant oil that can aggravate skin.

name: Cinnamomum
description: Can have antioxidant properties when applied to skin, but can aggravate skin.

name: Cinnamomum Camphora

name: Cinnamon
description: Can have antioxidant properties when applied to skin, but can aggravate skin.

description: A volatile fragrance chemical extracted from geranium, rose, and other plants, citronellol has a characteristic grassy, citrus-like scent.

name: Citrullus Colocynthis

name: Citrus Amara
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts

name: Citrus Aurantifolia

name: Citrus Aurantium

categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts

name: Citrus Reticulata (Tangerine) Leaf Oil

name: Clove Leaf

categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts

name: Clover Blossom
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Contains eugenol, which can be a skin sensitizer and cause photosensitivity.

name: Clover Leaf Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant plant oil that has the potential to irritate skin.

name: Coleus Barbatus
description: Member of the mint family and also known as forskolin; can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Colloidal Silver
description: Refers to ground-up silver suspended in solution.

name: Comfrey Extract
description: The alkaloid content of this extract means it has the potential to aggravate skin.

name: Commiphora Myrrha Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Has antimicrobial properties | Contains chemicals that are harmful to living cells | Also a potential skin sensitizer | Most used as a perfume ingredient | Commonly known as myrrh
description: This natural ingredient, also known as myrrh, has the potential to cause skin sensitization.

name: Cornmint
description: Also known as wild mint; it can be sensitizing to skin.

name: Cyclamen Aldehyde
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Irritant
description: Synthetic fragrant component in products; it can aggravate skin.

name: Cymbopogon Citrates
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
description: Plant that can have beneficial properties, but it also may be a skin sensitizer.

name: Cymbopogon Flexuosus Oil

description: Essential oil whose fragrance/volatile compounds pose a risk of irritation to skin.

name: Cymbopogon Martini
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
description: Plant that can have beneficial properties, but it also may be a skin sensitizer.

name: Daucus Carota

name: Denatured Alcohol
key_points: A type of volatile alcohol that can irritate skin | Depletes key substances in skin’s moisture barrier | Can be used as a solvent & to improve the texture of fluid/gel formulas | Volatility makes it a quick-drying ingredient that won’t leave a film | Enhances the penetration of other ingredients
description: Denatured alcohol has solvent and texture-enhancing properties in cosmetics but has proven to damage and dehydrate skin.

name: Dimethyl Ether
description: Colorless gas used as a propellant in aerosol products. It is potentially harmful if inhaled.

name: Elecampane
description: Latin name Inula helenium; it is a plant that can be very sensitizing to the skin.

name: English Ivy Extract
description: Plant extract that can be a skin sensitizer due to its stimulant and astringent (skin-constricting) properties.

name: Environmental Damage
description: Occurrence that takes place at an atomic level and is a complex physiological process.

name: Esculin
description: Component of horse chestnut, it is considered harmful and is not recommended for skin.

name: Essential Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
key_points: A group of primarily plant-derived volatile oils | Primarily used as a fragrant agent in cosmetics | Often include a mix of skin-sensitizing compounds | Can cause skin redness, dryness and flaking | Some essential oils also have antioxidant properties
description: Volatile fragrant ingredients containing many skin-sensitizing aromatic compounds.

name: Ethanol
description: Denatured alcohol used as a solvent. It can be drying and sensitizing to skin when one of the main ingredients in the formula.

name: Ethylene Brassylate
key_points: Ingredient used to impart a sweet, musky odor | Also used as a flavor additive | Research indicates it is non-toxic | Has potential to cause skin irritation | Colorless to pale yellow viscous liquid in its raw form
description: Synthetic fragrance ingredient used to impart a sweet, musky odor to cosmetics. Can irritate skin.

name: Eucalyptus Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Extract that may have beneficial properties on the skin. Despite those benefits, it's also a skin sensitizer, particularly on abraded skin.

name: Eucalyptus Oil
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant plant oil whose active constituents are found in the leaves and the oil obtained from them.

name: Eugenia Aromatica
description: Also known as clove, the leaf, oil, and extract from this plant can be potent skin sentizers when applied repeatedly.

name: Eugenia Caryophyllus Oil

description: This oil made from the buds of a flowering tree is highly aromatic and can irritate skin.

name: Eugenol
description: Fragrance chemical that occurs naturally in some plant ingredients.

name: Fennel Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts

name: Fennel Seed Extract

categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts

name: Fir Needle Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Volatile, fragrant oil that can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Floralozone

name: Foeniculum Vulgare Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Can have antioxidant properties, but on skin it can be a sensitizer.

name: Frankincense Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant component used in skin care products; it can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Gaultheria procumbens (wintergreen) leaf oil

name: Geranium Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant oil that can have beneficial properties but also can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Geranium Pratense
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Geranium plant.

name: Ginger Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: A fragrant plant oil that, depending on the species, can contain dozens of volatile compounds that have a known or potential risk to sensitize skin.

name: Grapefruit Oil
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
description: Citrus oil whose volatile components (chiefly substances known as furocoumarins) are sensitizing.

name: Grapefruit Peel Extract

name: Grapefruit Seed Extract
description: Labelled as Citrus paradisi (grapefruit) seed extract, this is often claimed as a natural preservative.

name: Hamamelis Virginiana

name: Hayflower Extract

name: Hedione
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
description: Synthetic fragrant component in products, which also can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Hexyl Cinnamal

name: Horse Elder
description: Latin name Inula helenium; it is a plant that can be very sensitizing to the skin.

name: Horseradish
description: Plant that can sensitize skin and should never be applied to abraded skin.

name: Ho Wood Oil

description: A fragrant essential oil derived from the bark of the camphor tree that contains skin-sensitizing compounds like linalool and camphor.

name: Hydnocarpus Anthelmintica
description: Potential skin irritant

name: Hydrastis Canadenis
description: Also known as goldenseal, this plant extract can irritate skin.

name: Hydrogen Peroxide
