description: Antibacterial, not commonly used in skin care due to its irritating effects.

name: Hydroxycitronellal
key_points: Skin-sensitizing fragrance used for its floral scent | Derived from the volatile fragrant compound citronellol | EU-identified as a “fragrance allergen” | Also used in other personal hygiene and care products
description: Synthetic fragrance compound with a floral scent that’s derived from the volatile citronellol. It can cause skin sensitization.

name: Illicium Verum Anise Fruit Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
key_points: Plant-derived cosmetic ingredient | Primarily used as a perfuming agent | Can have antioxidant properties | Often includes volatile aromatic compounds that can cause skin sensitization
description: Also known as aniseed, it can have antioxidant properties, but its fragrant components make this a potential skin sensitizer.

name: Inula Helenium
description: This plant can be very sensitizing to the skin.

name: Inula Helenium Extract
description: This plant extract can be very sensitizing to the skin.

name: Iris Florentina Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Potential skin irritant due to its fragrant component.

name: Iris Florentina Root
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Used primarily as a fragrant component due to its violet-like scent.

name: Irritants
key_points: Include ingredients such as harsh scrubs, drying alcohols, and essential oils | Damage skin both immediately and over time | Can increase oiliness in oily skin + dryness in dry skin | Many natural or organic ingredients can irritate skin
description: These ingredients, whether it’s noticeable or not, do damage to skin over time that can lead to increased dryness, breakouts, and redness.

name: Isopropyl Alcohol
key_points: Also called rubbing alcohol or isopropanol | Used in cosmetics and sunscreens as a solvent | Also a penetration enhancer | Well known to be drying and sensitizing
description: This type of alcohol is known to be drying and sensitizing to skin, especially with repeated use.

name: Ivy Extract
description: Plant extract that can be sensitizing due to its astringent (skin-constricting) properties.

name: Jasmine Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Emollient
description: Fragrant oil, often used as a source of perfume, that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Jasminium Grandiflorum
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
description: Commonly known as jasmine, this contains volatile fragrance chemicals (chiefly linalool) that can be skin sensitizers.

name: Jonquil Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Irritant
description: Fragrant plant extract that poses a strong risk of skin sensitization.

name: Juniper Berry
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: This plant, can have soothing properties, but can result in skin sensitivity if applied repeatedly.

name: Juniperus Communis
categories: Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant
description: This plant, also known as juniper, can have soothing properties, but can result in skin sensitivity if applied repeatedly.

name: Kathon CG
key_points: Also called Kathon™ Cosmetic Grade | Combination of two sensitizing synthetic preservatives | Can cause contact dermatitis
description: This cosmetics preservative is well known for its sensitizing and irritating impact on skin.

name: Kava-Kava Extract
key_points: Plant extract derived from the Piper methysticum plant | Applied topically and ingested | Can cause skin sensitivity, redness and itchiness | Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel hasn’t confirmed its safety
description: A plant extract taken from the roots or stump of the Piper methysticum plant that causes skin sensitivity when applied or ingested.

name: Kawa Extract
key_points: AKA kava-kava extract | Ingredient and plant extract derived from Piper methysticum | Can be applied topically and ingested | Can cause skin sensitivity, redness and itchiness
description: Plant extract, AKA kava-kava extract, that can cause redness, itchiness and skin sensitivity when applied or ingested.

name: Lady's Mantle Extract
key_points: Plant extract derived from the perennial, Alchemilla vulgaris | Might exhibit antioxidant benefits | Contains a type of tannin that denatures skin | Can cause dryness
description: Plant extract with antioxidants, among them skin-sensitizing tannins.

name: Laurus Nobilis
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Antioxidant, Irritant
key_points: Aromatic plant extract used in cosmetics, wellness and culinary endeavors | Can have antioxidant properties | Contains volatile fragrant compounds that sensitize skin | Might cause redness, irritation and dryness
description: Plant whose extracts and oils contain volatile fragrant compounds that can cause skin irritation.

name: Lavandin Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Essential oil derived from the Lavandula hybrida plant | Contains volatile aromatic compounds | Can sensitize skin | Used in cosmetics, homecare and household items
description: A hybrid lavender oil that contains volatile and skin-sensitizing aromatic compounds.

name: Lavandula Angustifolia
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Plant-based volatile oil taken from lavender | Contains fragrant compounds like linalool | Can cause short-term and long-term skin sensitization | Used in cosmetics in creams and lotions at concentrations between 0.015% and 0.1%
description: A plant, AKA lavender, whose aromatic extracts and oils can cause skin sensitization.

name: Lavandula Officinalis
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Previous name for Lavandula angustifolia, AKA lavender | Plant-based volatile oil taken from lavender | Contains fragrant compounds | Can cause skin sensitization after oxidization
description: Previous name for Lavandula angustifolia, AKA lavender. Contains volatile fragrant compounds that can sensitize skin.

name: Lavender Extract And Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Extracts and oils taken from Lavandula angustifolia | Contains pro-aging fragrant compounds | Volatile components can oxidize and trigger damage | Can cause skin redness and dryness
description: Fragrant ingredients taken from the Lavandula angustifolia plant that can cause skin sensitization.

name: Lemon
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Citrus fruit, AKA Citrus limon and Citrus medica limonum | Its oils, juices and extracts can cause skin sensitivity | Contains volatile fragrance compounds | Has photosensitizing compounds
description: AKA Citrus limon and Citrus media limonum, lemon can cause skin sensitivity due to photosensitive compounds, it’s high acidity and volatile fragrance chemicals.

name: Lemon Balm
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: This type of herb comes from the mint family. Though it has antioxidant properties, it also poses a risk of skin irritation due to its fragrant components.

name: Lemongrass Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
description: Extract that can have beneficial properties, but it also may be a skin sensitizer.

name: Lemongrass Oil
description: Also known as Oil of Verbena; can be effective as a mosquito repellent.

name: Lemon Juice
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Juice from the citrus lemon, AKA Citrus limon and Citrus medica limonum | Its high acidity can cause barrier disruption | Contains antioxidants and photosensitive compounds | Better to consume orally than apply topically
description: Highly acidic citrus based juice that can cause skin sensitization due to volatile compounds and a low pH.

name: Lemon Oil
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Fragrant volatile oil derived from lemon | Can be extracted from lemon stem, leaf, fruit, peel and seed | Contains fragrant, skin sensitizing compounds like limonene | Can cause photosensitivity
description: Commonly used citrus oil that can be a skin sensitizer, especially on abraded skin.

name: Levisticum Officinale Root Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Plant extract also known as lovage extract | Fragrant ingredient used in cosmetics | Can cause short-term and long-term skin sensitization | Also has applications in the food industry
description: Plant extract, AKA lovage root extract, that contains volatile fragrant compounds known to irritate skin.

name: Lime Oil And Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Citrus fruit whose volatile compounds are sensitizing.

name: Limonene
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Monoterpene commonly found in citrus oils | Primarily used as a fragrance in cosmetics | Oxidizes when exposed to air | Can cause skin sensitization
description: A volatile chemical compound often found in citrus oils. It’s used as a fragrance and solvent but can sensitize skin.

name: Linalool
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: A terpene alcohol found in certain plants, like lavender | Functions as a perfuming agent | Can cause skin sensitization | Appears as a colorless liquid as a raw material
description: A plant-derived fragrant compound that can cause skin sensitization, especially when exposed to air.

name: Litsea Cubeba
key_points: Plant that produces volatile, fragrant oils | Contains skin-sensitizing compounds, like citral, limonene and linalool | Antioxidant with potential anti-microbial properties | May cause skin redness, dryness and irritation
description: The litsea or may chang plant produces fragrant essential oils whose aromatic compounds, like citral, are known to irritate skin.

name: Litsea Cubeba Fruit Extract
key_points: Derived from the Litsea cubeba plant | Primarily used as a perfuming agent in cosmetics | Contains volatile and skin-sensitizing aromatic compounds | May cause dryness, redness and itchiness
description: Fragrant volatile oil and plant extract taken from the fruits of the Litsea cubeba plant that can sensitize skin.

name: Lovage Root Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Plant extract also known as Levisticum officinale root extract | Fragrance and perfuming ingredient | Can cause short- and long-term skin sensitization | Also has applications in the food industry
description: Plant extract, AKA Levisticum officinale root extract, that contains volatile fragrant compounds known to irritate skin.

name: Lye
description: A highly alkaline ingredient used in small amounts in cosmetics.

name: Mandarin Orange Oil Or Extract
description: Primarily used as a fragrance; it can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Marjoram
key_points: Essential oil taken from the Origanum majorana plant | Aromatic, volatile compounds are present in its volatile oils | Can sensitize skin | Often used in the food industry as a seasoning
description: The essential oils and extracts taken from the Origanum majorana plant contain volatile aromatic compounds which can sensitize skin.

name: Melaleuca Cajeputi Oil
key_points: Plant derived essential oil derived from the Melaleuca cajeputi tree | Primarily serves as a perfuming agent in cosmetics | Can cause skin sensitization | From the same genus as the tree (Melaleuca alternifolia) that produces tea tree oil
description: A volatile, plant-derived oil primarily used as a perfuming agent. This oil contains fragrant compounds like cineole, linalool and terpineol that can sensitize skin.

name: Melissa Officinalis
categories: Anti-Aging, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
key_points: Commonly known as lemon balm | Has antioxidant and antimicrobial properties | Certain components can protect skin against blue light and improve barrier function | Oil is sensitizing and can cause allergic contact dermatitis
description: This herbaceous plant has antioxidant properties, but its oil can be sensitizing to skin.

name: Mentha Arvensis Extract
key_points: A species of plant (AKA corn mint) from the mint family | Extracts can contain menthone, a sensitizing compound that offers a unique cooling sensation | Other components include menthone and isomenthol, volatile fragrant compounds | Can cause skin sensitization including redness, dryness, itchiness and tightness | Also offers antioxidant properties (but they’re not worth the risk of irritation)
description: Mentha arvensis (AKA corn mint) extract comes from a plant species that produces oils and extracts that contain sensitizing compounds including menthol, menthone and isomenthol.

name: Mentha Piperita
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Both the oil and the extract can have disinfectant properties, but they can also have a sensitizing effect on skin.

name: Mentha Spicata
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Also known as spearmint, this is the source of a volatile oil that can be sensitizing when applied topically to skin.

name: Mentha Viridis (Spearmint) Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: The spearmint plant is also known as Mentha spicata | Used in cosmetics primarily as a perfuming agent | Contains 1,8-cineole, limonene and carvone, sensitizing aromatic compounds | Can also contain antioxidant properties, but the irritation risk isn’t worth it
description: Mentha viridis (spearmint) extract, also known as Mentha spicata, is a species of plant that produces minty fragrant oils with volatile aromatic compounds that can sensitize skin.

name: Menthol
categories: Irritant, Plant Extracts, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural
key_points: Plant extract derived from peppermint | Used as a fragrance in skin care and cosmetics | Offers a unique cooling sensation when applied topically | Can cause skin sensitization
description: Skin sensitizing plant extract derived from peppermint used largely for its scent and its unique cooling sensation when applied topically.

name: Menthone
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Volatile plant extract commonly derived from peppermint | Exhibits a minty scent | Can cause skin sensitization | Also has applications in the health and food industries
description: Skin-sensitizing plant extract commonly derived from peppermint used largely for its scent and unique cooling sensation when applied topically.

name: Menthoxypropanediol
key_points: Synthetic derivative of menthol | Most commonly used in lip care | Incites a cooling sensation when topically applied | Can cause skin sensitization
description: Menthoxypropanediol is a fragrant and cooling cosmetics ingredient most often used in lip care that can cause skin sensitization.

name: Menthyl Lactate
key_points: Derivative of menthol | Exhibits a light, minty scent | Prompts a cool, tingling sensation when applied topically | Can cause skin sensitization
description: Menthyl lactate is an ester of menthol used in skin care and cosmetics for its scent and cooling effect, but it can cause sensitivity.

name: Methanol
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Solvent
key_points: A synthetic, volatile alcohol | Can also be referred to as methyl alcohol | Used to help created denatured alcohol | Is toxic to humans when inhaled, ingested or applied topically
description: Methanol is a volatile, organic alcohol used to help denature other forms of alcohol. When used on its own, it’s toxic when inhaled, applied topically or ingested.

name: Methylchloroisothiazolinone
key_points: Also referred to as MCI, or Kathon CG (when in an ingredient blend) | Used as a preservative when combined with methylisothiazolinone | Is a well-known skin sensitizer | Can only be used in leave-on products at 7.5 ppm (parts per million) and rinse-off products at 15 ppm
description: Methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI) is a skin sensitizing organic compound used as a preservative when combined with methylisothiazolinone.

name: Methyldibromo Glutaronitrile
key_points: Has preservative properties that helps keep products free of microorganisms | Demonstrates a track record of skin sensitization | Can cause irritation, dryness and flaking | European Union banned usage in cosmetics several years ago
description: Methyldibromo glutaronitrile is a well-known skin sensitizer that has preservative properties.

name: Methylisothiazolinone
key_points: Also referred to as MI, or Kathon CG (when in an ingredient blend) | Used as a preservative when combined with methylchloroisothiazolinone | Is a well-known skin sensitizer | Limited use in leave-on products at 7.5 ppm (parts per million) and rinse-off products at 15 ppm when in a blend
description: Methylisothiazolinone (MI or MIT) is a skin sensitizing compound used as a preservative in cosmetics alongside methylchloroisothiazolinone (MCI).

name: Methyl Salicylate
key_points: Also known as wintergreen oil | Used for its numbing and cooling effect | Skin sensitizer and irritant | Yellowish or reddish liquid in its raw form
description: Also known as wintergreen oil, this ingredient is a skin irritant.

name: Mint
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
key_points: Mint’s a genus of plants, AKA Mentha | Notable species include Mentha spicata (spearmint), Mentha x piperita (peppermint) | Often contain volatile and sensitizing fragrant compounds | Can cause short-and long-term skin irritation
description: Mint, AKA Mentha, is a genus of plants often used in skin care for its fragrance. Some species in this genus are also used for their unique cooling sensation.

name: Myrrh
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant gum resin that can be a skin sensitizer. There is little research showing it has any benefit for skin.

name: Narcissus Poeticus Flower Wax
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant cosmetic ingredient that contains volatile compounds, like benzyl benzoate and limonene, that can trigger skin sensitization. Also used as a texture enhancer.

name: Neroli
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant plant that is most sensitizing to skin in its oil form.

name: Neroli Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant plant oil that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Olibanum Extract
description: Fragrant component used in skin care products; it can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Orange Blossom
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Orange blossoms are the white-to-ivory flowers characteristic of orange trees | These blossoms can produce extracts, oil and waters | Used primarily for perfuming in cosmetics and skin care | Its aromatic compounds, like linalool, can sensitize skin
description: A fragrant group of skin care ingredients (oils, extracts and waters) most commonly derived from the flowers of Citrus sinensis and Citrus aurantium orange trees whose volatile fragrant compounds can sensitize skin.

name: Orchid
categories: Hydration, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Humectant
description: Fragrant flower that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Orchid Extract
categories: Hydration, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Humectant
description: Fragrant flower that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Oregano
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Has beneficial properties, but can also be a skin sensitizer.

name: Origanum Majorana
key_points: Aromatic volatile oil from the Origanum majorana, AKA marjoram, plant | Includes phenolic compounds that can have antioxidant properties | Contains potent skin-sensitizing fragrant compounds | Used as a seasoning in the food industry
description: A plant extract and volatile oil that contains skin-sensitizing aromatic compounds. Also known (and used in foods) as marjoram.

name: Origanum Vulgare Flower Extract
description: Has beneficial properties, but can also be a skin sensitizer.

name: Orris Root
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Used primarily as a fragrant component due to its violet-like scent.

name: Palmarosa Oil
description: Fragrant oil that can have beneficial properties but also can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Papain
categories: Smooths Bumpy Skin, Exfoliant, Plant Extracts, Irritant
key_points: An enzyme derived from papaya latex | Has exfoliating properties when applied topically | Can sensitize and irritate skin since it just keeps exfoliating | Promotes dryness through increasing transepidermal water loss
description: Exfoliating enzyme present in papaya latex that can irritate skin and disturb its barrier.

name: Para-Aminobenzoic Acid (PABA)
description: Sunscreen ingredient rarely used since the 1990s because of strong potential for sensitizing reactions.

name: Parfum/Fragrance
key_points: Also known as fragrance or parfum | Best known for perfuming and masking scent benefits | Can sensitize skin in the short- and long-term | Ongoing use of fragranced products can harm skin’s long-term healthy appearance | Routinely using multiple fragranced products risks compounding the damage
description: AKA fragrance, volatile substances capable of sensitizing skin. Often used to impart a scent or mask unwanted formulary aromas.

name: Patchouli Essential Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Also known as Pogostemon cablin leaf oil | Best known as a perfuming agent in cosmetics | Has a musky, earthy aroma | Contains volatile, skin-sensitizing compounds like eugenol
description: Fragrant oil derived from mint. It contains eugenol and can aggravate skin.

name: Pelargonium Graveolens Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant oil (geranium) that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Pellitory
description: Plant whose root extract can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Pentadecalactone
key_points: A fragrant skin care ingredient with a musky, powdery scent | Also referred to as cyclopentadecanolide | Can sensitize skin due to volatile aromatic compounds | Is also used in the personal care and household goods industries
description: Pentadecalactone is a sensitizing ingredient used in skin care as a fragrance or masking agent due to its musky, powdery scent.

name: Peppermint
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Both the oil and the extract can have disinfectant properties, but they can also have a sensitizing effect on skin.

name: Petitgrain Mandarin
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: This citrus plant has the potential to irritate skin due to its fragrance components.

name: Photosensitizer
description: Ingredient that can cause the skin to have a sensitizing reaction when exposed to sunlight.

name: Pine Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Essential oil derived from many species of pine trees and shrubs | Used as a perfuming/masking agent in cosmetics | Contains aromatic compounds that can irritate skin | Has an earthy, pine scent | Does not have strong antimicrobial properties
description: Perfuming agent whose fresh, needle-derived pine scent can sensitize skin.

name: Pinus Lambertiana Wood Extract
description: Pine extract that may aggravate skin.

name: Pinus Palustris Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: An essential oil also known as pine oil | Derived from the twigs, leaves and needles of the Pinus palustris tree | Used as a perfuming agent in cosmetics | Contains skin-sensitizing volatile aromatic compounds
description: This fragrant plant-derived fragrant ingredient derived from the longleaf pine tree can irritate skin when applied topically.

name: Piper Nigrum
description: It can cause significant skin sensitivity.

name: Pogostemon Cablin
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant oil derived from mint. It contains eugenol and can aggravate skin.

name: Potentilla Erecta Root Extract
description: Plant that can be irritating due to its tannin content, which causes skin constriction.

name: Pumice
key_points: Type of volcanic rock characterized by its porous nature | Often used to scrub rough, calloused patches of skin | Pumice powder (pumicite) is sometimes used as a manual exfoliant | Poses a significant risk of skin irritation and barrier disruption
description: This volcanic rock is highly abrasive and can cause skin barrier damage.

name: Pyrus Cydonia
description: More commonly known as quince, this plant has astringent properties and may cause skin sensitivity.

name: Quercus
description: Refers to hundreds of species of oak. Extracts of Quercus can have beneficial properties but they can also be skin sensitizing.

name: Quercus Alba Bark Extract
description: The bark extract from a type of oak that can be sensitizing when applied topically.

name: Quercus Infectoria Extract
description: This extract originating from a species of oak can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Quince Seed
description: Used as a thickening agent in cosmetics, but also has skin-constricting properties.

name: Robinia Pseudacacia Extract
description: Extract that can have antioxidant properties, although it also may have harmful components for skin.

name: Rosa Damascena Flower Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
key_points: Essential oil obtained from the petals of the damask rose | Poses a risk of irritation to skin due to its volatile fragrant compounds | Requires a large amount of Rosa damascena petals to yield a small amount of the oil
description: Rose-derived essential oil with volatile fragrant compounds that pose a risk of irritation to skin.

name: Rosa Damascena Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Oil of a very fragrant pink rose used as fragrance in cosmetics.

name: Rosa Gallica Flower Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Also known as French rose extract | Used as a perfuming agent for its floral scent | Contains volatile compounds that can irritate skin | Offers antioxidant properties
description: Plant-derived ingredient often used in skin care as fragrance and a source of antioxidants. The problem?  It can sensitize skin.

name: Rose Flower
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Highly fragrant substance that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Rose Flower Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Fragrant, volatile oil that can aggravate skin.

name: Rosemary Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
key_points: Oil from the rosemary plant | Long used in traditional folk medicine | Volatile compounds can lead to irritation, including allergic contact dermatitis | Milder reactions after topical exposure include itching and redness
description: This oil from the rosemary plant can cause irritation, including allergic contact dermatitis.

name: Rose Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Fragrant, volatile oil that can aggravate skin.

name: Rosewood Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
key_points: Also called bois de rose oil | Primarily used as a fragrance ingredient | Contains high amounts of sensitizing linalool
description: This oil contains high amounts of linalool, which can cause skin irritation.

name: Sandalwood Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Antioxidant
description: Fragrant oil (Latin name Santalum album) that can cause skin sensitivity, especially when used in pure concentrations.

name: Sausurrea Oil
categories: Irritant, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts
description: Also called costus oil. Volatile oil and fragrant component used in cosmetics; it can be a skin sensitizer.

name: SD Alcohol
key_points: Is a volatile alcohol, also known as specially denatured alcohol | Can cause skin dryness and potential barrier disruption | Most commonly functions as a solvent in cosmetic formulas | Also has anti-foaming and astringent properties
description: Volatile denatured alcohols that can cause dryness and potential barrier disruption when used in high concentrations for their solvent properties.

name: SD Alcohol 40
description: Denatured alcohol used as a solvent. It can be drying and sensitizing to skin when one of the main ingredients in the formula.

name: Silver
description: Metallic element that in cosmetics can have disinfecting properties; however, prolonged contact can turn skin grayish blue. Silver can be sensitizing to skin.

name: Sisymbrium Irio Seed Oil
categories: Hydration, Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Essential oil extracted from a plant commonly known as “London rocket” | Contains fragrant compounds that can be harmful when applied topically to skin | Also contains antioxidants and fatty acids | Has a yellow to greenish brown oily liquid appearance
description: Essential oil whose fragrant compounds pose a risk of irritation to skin.

name: Soap
description: Most soaps are considered very drying due to their alkaline base (i.e., a pH over 8). Bar cleansers can be gentler than bar soaps, but are more often than not still drying, depending on their composition.

name: Sodium Borate
description: A compound used in cosmetics in small quantities primarily as a pH adjuster.

name: Sodium C14-16 Olefin Sulfonate
key_points: A powerful anionic (water- and oil-loving) surfactant | Has cleansing and foaming properties | Often used in skin, body, hair and home care products | Can disrupt the skin barrier, causing dryness and sensitization
description: Sensitizing anionic surfactant with cleansing and foaming properties. It can disrupt skin’s barrier, causing dryness due to water loss.

name: Sodium Carbonate
description: Absorbent salt used in cosmetics; it can also be a skin sensitizer.

name: Sodium Lauryl Sulfate
description: Versatile ingredient composed of several non-volatile alcohols. Functions primarily as a surfactant...

name: Sodium Silicate
description: Highly alkaline and potentially sensitizing  mineral used in cosmetics...

name: Sodium Tallowate
key_points: Sodium salt of tallow | Made through a process involving lye | Has a high pH | Can cause skin barrier damage and irritation
description: This sodium salt of tallow has a high pH that can lead to skin barrier damage and water loss.

name: Sodium Thioglycolate
description: A synthetic ingredinet that functions as a reducing agent in cosmetics, most typically hair-removal lotions.

name: Spearmint Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant, volatile oil that can cause skin sensitivity.

name: Star Anise
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
description: Also known as aniseed, it can have antioxidant properties, but its fragrant components make this a potential skin sensitizer.

name: Styrax Benzoin
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: Family of trees native to Asia | Generates plant-based oils, extracts, gums and resins | Used as perfuming agents in cosmetics | Can cause skin-sensitization
description: Styrax benzoin is a family of trees that generates aromatic cosmetic ingredients that can sensitize skin.

name: Styrax Benzoin Resin Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
key_points: A resin derived from Styrax benzoin trees | Contains volatile, skin-sensitizing aromatic compounds | Has a warm, vanilla scent | Can also be used as a part of preservative blends
description: Styrax benzoin resin extract is a plant-derived ingredient used as a perfuming agent in cosmetics. It’s capable of sensitizing skin.

name: Sulfur
description: Sulfur has more negatives than positives for skin, and its use to treat skin concerns should be seen as a last resort if other ingredients (such as benzoyl peroxide, azelaic acid, and salicylic acid) don't work as well as you had hoped.

name: Symphytum Officinale Extract
key_points: Plant extract with some potential skin benefits | Contains pyrrolizidine alkaloids, associated with health risks | Safety profile remains uncertain due to limited research | Best to avoid when it comes to personal care products
description: Controversial herb-derived ingredient with conflicting research on its safety in for topical use.

name: Szechuan Peppercorn
description: From a plant native to Szechuan Province in China. Szechuan pepper is known for the "numbing" sensation it produces on the tongue.

name: Tangerine Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Plant Extracts, Emollient
description: Fragrant, volatile citrus oil that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: TEA-Lauryl Sulfate
key_points: Also known as triethanolamine lauryl sulfate | Functions as a surfactant | Drying to skin and hair | Significant skin irritant in high concentrations
description: This cleansing agent is drying and is irritating in high amounts.

name: Thyme Oil
description: Source of potent antioxidants, but its fragrant components (which are part of the oil itself) pose a risk of sensitivity.

name: Thymus Vulgaris Oil
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: More commonly known as thyme oil. Like most fragrant plant oils, thyme is a source of potent antioxidants but its fragrant components (which are part of the oil itself) pose a risk of sensitivity.

name: Tormentil Extract
description: Plant that can be irritating due to its tannin content, which causes skin constriction.

name: UVA
description: Ultraviolet A radiation comes from the sun and creates serious negative cumulative changes in skin.

name: UVB
description: Ultraviolet B radiation.

name: Verbena Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant extract that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Vetiver Oil or Extract
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant component in skincare products that also has some beneficial properties.

name: Volatile Oil
description: Group of volatile fluids derived primarily from plants and used in cosmetics primarily as fragrant.

name: White Oak Bark Extract
description: Potentially irritating plant extract.

name: Wild Ginger
description: Plant that has antioxidant capabilities for skin, but whose oil can be a skin irritant.

name: Witch Hazel
categories: Oil Control, Irritant, Plant Extracts, Antioxidant
key_points: Commonly used plant extract from the Hamamelis virginiana shrub | Can have potent astringent, anti-irritant, and skin soothing properties | Its high tannin content can also make it sensitizing to skin | Can be derived from different parts of the plant
description: Plant extract that can deliver antioxidant properties but is also sensitizing if used repeatedly because it denatures proteins that help keep skin healthy.

name: Xi Xin
description: Best known as ginger, this plant can have soothing an antioxidant activity, but its oil form can be sensitizing.

name: Ylang Ylang
categories: Fragrance: Synthetic and Natural, Irritant, Plant Extracts
description: Fragrant, volatile oil that can be a skin sensitizer.

name: Zanthoxylum Piperitum
description: A plant native to Szechuan Province in China. The Szechuan pepper that comes from it is known for the "numbing" sensation it produces on the tongue.

name: Zanthoxylum Piperitum Fruit Extract
description: From a plant native to Szechuan Province in China. Szechuan pepper is known for the "numbing" sensation it produces on the tongue.

name: Zinc Carbonate
description: Can be sensitizing when applied to skin. Most well known for use in calamine.

name: Zinc Sulfate
key_points: Created through the reaction of sulfuric acid and zinc oxide | Said to have preservative and anti-acne properties | Conflicting reports and research surround its ability to help acne-prone skin | Can cause skin sensitization when applied topically
description: Preservative ingredient that can cause skin sensitization. There are conflicting reports about whether it is beneficial for acne-prone skin.

name: Zingiber Zerumbet
description: A type of ginger, it can have antioxidant properties for skin, but its oil is a skin irritant.

name: Zingiber Zerumbet Extract
